alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:31PM CDT until May 26 at 1:05PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River at Fulton. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Farmland at the gage site becomes covered by flood waters, and Highway 31, east of town becomes flooded. Highway 31, four miles west of Fulton has flood waters four to six feet in depth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 25.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 03/05/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 845 PM CDT.
